title: Any champs that can play all lanes ?
body: *I feel like I've never come across a Champion that can play all lanes (Top/Jung/Mid/Bot) successfully, sure you could say {{champion:31}} or {{champion:48}} or even{{champion:154}} could play all lanes. However this would take tremendous amounts of "Player skill" so to speak. Does anyone have any champs they think can suite the category of a "Quadruple Threat"?*

replies.body:
{{champion:10}}  Kayle can. Easy. 
She has a strong kit that is good in all lanes, even jungling.
Hell, you can even ADC or Support with her. Also, the people who are good with her are terrifying.
What would you reccomend an ADC Kayle build?
Start with TriForce, then a mix of Attack Speed and CD, Try a Blade of Ruined King, also had CD runes
If we don't have enough CD should we start with CD focus so we can spam the E a lot?

No, as long as you have some CD runes, after about level 3(?) you can spam E constantly. 
If you don't have those runes, all you need is 20% CD to spam E, so yes go for something with a small amount of CD.
Essence Reaver could work well on her for that reason, also the extra mana is helpful.
Fiddlesticks.

{{champion:10}}: All 5 roles
{{champion:117}}: top, mid, support, ADC(not optimal, but doable)
{{champion:9}}: top, mid, support, and jungle
{{champion:31}}: top, mid, jungle, support(I personally think the fact that he requires CS to refill his puny mana pool makes him a terrible support, though)
{{champion:18}}{{champion:104}}{{champion:236}} : could go top or mid, but only recommended if you're team comp accounts for it.
{{champion:76}}: top, mid, support, ADC
{{champion:85}}: top, mid, ADC
{{champion:48}}: jungle and top, viable mid and support as a counter pick to to melee mids/supports.

As a matter of fact, most champions are viable in any lane besides the jungle "lane" if the counter is hard enough or you can effectively abuse the opponent not expecting or knowing how to fight the matchup.  My first game as Singed, the enemy team switched their support Soraka with their original top laner.

The fun thing about Tristana mid is that your opponent wont know whether you're going AP or AD until the match starts, meaning they'll have to guess what defensive runes/masteries to use.
I think there are more than this, but Kayle is amazing anywhere.   Yasuo and Ez(and GP sorta) can do pretty much whatever they want(though I'm not a big fan of Yas top).

{{champion:85}} Kennen top. Kennen mid. Ranged champs can jungle abusing leash mechanics (wouldn't recommend it)... Kennen ADC is actually pretty decent. Kennen support actually got pro play last year (decent manaless poke and engage)

twisted fate- top lane, mid lane, jg , adc and support 

support cause he got slow and stun
{{champion:54}}  he can top, mid, jungle, and support
no adc

Scrolled, looking for this.

Malphite so freakin OP
Pair malph with kalista in bot lane the ult combo is so amazing

{{champion:29}} {{champion:67}}{{champion:133}}  Top, Mid, Jungle, ADC. Twitch and quinn are known junglers, but Vayne can surprisingly jungle with her crazy kiting. Twitch top actually saw competitive play I believe.

{{champion:10}} {{champion:85}}{{champion:117}}   All 5 roles. I've seen Lulu jungle work.
that was most likely a lane swap on the twitch top.
teemo can do it all maybe twisted fate too idk how well his support would work
Lee Sin

^ not well. Bottom lane wouldn't work for him Support wise due to the fact that he needs more expensive items to be effective, and supports don't CS for that amount of gold, and well, he is certainly not a Marksman for very obvious reasons. He's great Jungle though!

{{champion:223}} 
Slows, stuns, sustain, shields, mid laner, top laner, support, hell even jungle, tank, bruiser, etc. Tahm Kench has it all.
1. {{champion:126}} Jayce, can effectively top, mid, jg, and adc. I'm not sure about support, but he is pretty OP in any lane, although he does require a bit of skill to master.

Think more "role" than specific lanes, and that's the key to breaking the mold/meta here.

Cho'Gath is a prime example of a melee with ranged abilities who can build anywhere between tanky and AP. With his sustain, he can easily jungle, go against tanks/bruisers, assassins and mages, and sometimes I can see him supporting and doing just fine.

The roles are more important than the lanes. Picking a Riven top with a Shaco jungle isn't always the best idea, for instance, even if that's where they are "meta." 

Mid lane, from my experience, tends to be the snowball lane and holds champions who scale the best with levels (assassins to hit 6 and other power spikes to, well, assassinate. They don't do as well in other roles because their power spikes are delayed. Mages for base damages as well). Utility mages, however, are popular in mid as well as support, and a few go solo top since they aren't as reliant on levels and they have enough utility and damage to solo lane as well as teamfight. Lulu used to be like this and can be still with team comps such as Juggermaw, and other champions.
Urgot
{{champion:117}} {{champion:85}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:41}} work in all 5 roles.
{{champion:150}}

Thresh can be played any role. Support? Obvious. ADC? Heck yeah. Mid? Really strong if you know how to do it. Jungle? It works pretty well.
But his best lane by far? Top. Farm for days and 2 shot anyone and then 1v4 the rest of the enemy team until your team arrives. He's the opposite of Nasus, with Thresh you farm for Tankiness from souls, (and damage from them) and build pure damage and MR.

I've seen thresh top, its pretty damn good if you don't get trolled and if they don't have too much hard engage. I'd probably take Thresh vs. a passively farming top lane or one without too much hard engage. His biggest problem is lack of escapes pre-6 and needing a jungler to set up his first kill, after which he can bully and zone like no other.
{{champion:17}} His toxic can pretty much do for anything, in any lane. Q-Q LOL

{{champion:10}} - really good any where, and can fill almost any role.

{{champion:74}} - Can technically head into any lane, but in bot lane he should be the support. Yes, jungle donger is a thing.

{{champion:35}} - balanced on a razor's edge, you will either dominate your lane or get dominated. Either way, you decide the outcome of the entire game. Not for the faint of heart, requires mastering.
